revised_title: Experiments on the Congelation of Quicksilver and Production of Artificial Cold
tldr: The author, Richard Walker, conducted experiments to determine the conditions necessary for congealing mercury and producing artificial cold. He used a mixture of diluted vitriolic acid and strong fuming nitrous acid, and added snow to lower the temperature. Walker discovered that he could successfully freeze mercury and observed its properties, paving the way for further research in cryogenics and temperature measurement.
